title: [$250] Report - "Waiting for you to submit expenses" message seen when there is only one expense.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.19-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-962/folder/13176670/41237093/920382464 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1852@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace available. Prerequisite 2: Delayed submissions and approvals enabled. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Open the just created expense. 5. Note that a "Waiting for you to submit expenses" message can be seen on top of report, despite only having one expense created. 6. Tap on "Submit" 7. Note that now "Waiting for you to approve" message can be seen, and the word "Expenses" appears and disappears. ## Expected Result: When an expense is pending submit, message displayed on report should be "Waiting for you to submit expense(s), and when expense is pending approved, message should be "Waiting for you to approve expense(s). ## Actual Result: When there is only one expense on report, that is pending submit, report displays a "Waiting for you to submit expenses", in plural, and when expense is submitted, message seen is "Waiting for you to approve", and word "Expenses", appears and disappears. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73b5b0eb-224e-4ba8-8261-19c2e7ad85d9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Make it more apparent in the expense chat carousel view when expenses are added to a report

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background
Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03TME82F/p1758749625648629), we'd like to make it more apparent in the expense chat carousel view when expenses are added to a report.

## Proposal
More specifically, new expenses should slide in **and** there should be a highlight that fades out slowly:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/77216c3e-8434-4061-b065-737ef93480d4

cc @Expensify/design 

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @rushatgabhane</details>

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.18-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @dylanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1758884278730649) ## Action Performed: 1. Sign up as a new user 2. Complete the personal details step 3. When prompted to join available workspaces, click Skip 4. On the next screen, select Track and budget expenses. ## Expected Result: The onboarding flow should show a screen asking if the member wants to create a workspace, User should be guided to set up a workspace before being dropped into the main chat. ## Actual Result: Onboarding flow completes immediately, User is dropped into the #admins chat with no prompt to create a workspace. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Create a couple of expenses 2. Upload a receipt image that will fail SmartScan 3. Wait for SmartScan processing to complete 4. Observe the LHN (Left-Hand Navigation). ## Expected Result: The RBR should only post in the workspace chat (the highest context chat). The expense thread should not display an RBR entry in the LHN. ## Actual Result: The RBR appears in the expense thread in the LHN, creating confusion. The RBR also appears in the workspace chat (duplicated visibility). ## Workaround: Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround? ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.18-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1758841461547489) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite : Admin of a workspace with invited members 1. Navigate to workflows of the workspace 2. Click on the default approval workflow 3. Click on the Approver row 4. Select a member form the list ## Expected Result: As a single select list, the Save button is not necessary here. Making a selection to take that action and navigate back to approval workflow page before it. ## Actual Result: A Save button appears after selecting a member. Users click this Save button and assume the change is saved. They often miss the second Save button on the main approval workflow page, resulting in unsaved changes. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

Sign in to ND with a new gmail account 2. Choose the "Track" intent 3. Go to Create expense > Manual 4. Enter an amount > next 5. Type "manager" in the input field - observe the tooltip position (it is below the Manager's contact) 6. Continue typing characters that will not bring any result 7. Tap delete button the keyboard until there is a "manager" in the input, the Manager with a tooltip is shown at the top of the results 8. Continue delete button in the keyboard until all the text is removed 9. Observe the tooltip - it's pointing on the (you) result as it at the top now ## Expected Result: "Choose our test manager and try it out" tooltip follows the Manager's icon while searching contacts on "Choose recipient" page ## Actual Result: The tooltip does not follow the Manager's icon properly ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/498d2c93-bcdb-4eb3-911f-611b691b5674 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Middle truncate all lists in the RHP, categories, and tags

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack conversation - https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1758753730735929 ## Problem Users are unable to fully view credit card account names when selecting a card to export company card expenses in the RHP. The account names are truncated, making it difficult to distinguish between cards. This issue was observed during onboarding calls and confirmed by internal team members. ## Why is this important? Truncated account names hinder usability and create confusion, particularly when multiple similar cards exist. This affects the user experience during a critical workflow and can lead to errors in selecting the correct account. Multiple users, including those with large displays, report this limitation. It also negatively impacts adoption for teams using hierarchical tags or categories. ## Solution Implement middle truncation (e.g., "Americ...1234") for consistency with other UI patterns.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.18-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70629 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 18.5 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Sign on to ND 2. Go to account > troubleshoot and turn on debug mode 3. Create new, empty workspace 4. Add a new report with one expense 5. Add a second report with one expense - it has to have same amount, merchant and category in order to become a potential duplicate with the previous one 6. Navigate to the Inbox and press View button to open DebugReportPage 7. Scroll down to the DateTime fields 8. Open one of the Daytime field, verify the cursor is at the end of the Time 9. Try to change the data by tapping "<" button on the opened keyboard ## Expected Result: When tapping "<" button, the last number changes to 0 ## Actual Result: When tapping "<" button, the app crashes ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31349fac-635a-4e33-824c-ce1e348b1d4e [Bug6955797_1758828768828!Crash_1.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22547631/Bug6955797_1758828768828.Crash_1.txt) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
